Title: 13.3.4 The BLOB and TEXT Types
Description: A TEXT column with a maximum length of 65,535 (216 âˆ’ 1) bytes. The effective maximum length is less if the value contains multibyte characters. Each TEXT value is stored using a 2-byte length prefix that indicates the number of bytes in the value.
An optional length M can be given for this type. If this is done, MySQL creates the column as the smallest TEXT type large enough to hold values M characters long.
